perturbation.original_text:
Resolution of Disputes. In the event of any dispute arising out of this Agreement, MICOA and Agency agree to submit such dispute to arbitration as follows:

                  a.       There shall be three arbitrators; one shall be
                            selected by the Agency, one shall be selected by
                            MICOA, and a third shall be selected by those two
                            arbitrators. If the two arbitrators cannot agree on
                            the selection of a third, American Arbitration
                            Association's regional office closest to Agency's
                            main office shall be requested to appoint the third
                            arbitrator.

                  b.       The determination of the arbitrators shall be final
                            and binding upon the Agency and MICOA.

                  c.       Neither MICOA nor the Agency shall be entitled to
                            punitive and/or exemplary damages.

                  d.       The arbitration shall be conducted in accordance with
                            the procedures of the above referenced regional
                            office of the American Arbitration Association. The
                            Agency and MICOA shall pay the cost of their
                            arbitrator and share equally in the expense of the
                            third arbitrator.

                  e.       Either Party, may where permitted by the law of
                            Nevada, enter judgment upon the arbitrators' award.
perturbation.changed_text:
10.      Year 2000 Compliance. Agency must at times assure that any of                   its computers, data processing systems, software components,                   and network arrangements use for MICOA business completely and                   accurately, present, produce, store and calculate all dates                   after December 31, 1999; and that they will not produce                   abnormally ending or incorrect results involving such dates as                   used in any forward or regression data based functions. All                   such items must yield date-related functionalities and date                   fields which accurately indicate the century and millennium                   and correctly perform all calculations involving a four digit                   year field.

Resolution of Disputes. In the event of any dispute arising out of this Agreement, MICOA and Agency agree to submit such dispute to arbitration as follows:

                  a.  In cases of disputes, both parties may choose mediation as a first step, without forfeiting their right to arbitration.

                  b.       The determination of the arbitrators shall not be final
                            and binding upon the Agency and MICOA. Instead, either party may appeal the arbitrator's decision within 30 days.

                  c.  Punitive and/or exemplary damages may be awarded at the arbitrator's discretion.

                  d.  The arbitration shall be conducted in accordance with the procedures of an arbitrator chosen mutually. The Agency and MICOA shall pay the cost of their arbitrator and share equally in the expense of the third arbitrator, or each pay for an agreed-upon single arbitrator.

                  e.  Either Party, may where permitted by the law of Nevada, enter judgment upon the arbitrators' award, unless appealed.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates arbitration and details its procedure. The modified clause adds the option of mediation, weakens the binding nature of arbitration, allows for punitive damages, and alters arbitration procedures. This contradicts the original clause's firm arbitration agreement, making enforcement uncertain. The Year 2000 Compliance section placement obscures it, as it is not easily found within the dispute resolution section.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Nevada Arbitration Law, potentially Federal Arbitration Act if the contract involves interstate commerce

perturbation.original_text:
Agency's Errors and Omission, and Fidelity & Electronic Crime Insurance

         The Agency will maintain valid errors and omissions insurance, with          minimum limits of $1,000,000 per incident, and a fidelity and          electronic crime policy through an insurer, both of which shall contain          terms and limits of coverage acceptable to MICOA covering the Agency's          solicitors and each of its employees. The Agency shall provide MICOA a          copy of each policy; doing so on a regular and current basis shall be a          precondition to all of Agency's rights under this Agreement, including          but not limited to the payment of all earned commissions.
perturbation.changed_text:
H. Potential Opportunities
         1. Other Programs. Agency and MICOA agree that Agency may be                   offered the opportunity to support MICOA's workers'                   compensation, and its other nonphysician professional                   liability or product programs in Nevada when MICOA proceeds                   with related marketing plans. Such plans may also include                   Agency's involvement in sales of MICOA commercial and personal                   products. Appropriate agreements must be negotiated separately                   from this agreement for each such product, and for each such                   territory, including but not limited to Nevada.

         Agency's Errors and Omission, and Fidelity & Electronic Crime Insurance

         The Agency will maintain valid errors and omissions insurance but is not required to provide a copy of each policy to MICOA unless MICOA requests the copy. Terms and limits of coverage shall be determined by the Agency alone.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause requires the Agency to maintain specific insurance and provide copies to MICOA as a precondition. The modified clause removes the mandatory provision of providing policy copies and weakens the requirement that MICOA approve of the terms of coverage, instead giving the agency autonomy over the terms of the insurance. The section relocation to 'Potential Opportunities' makes it less prominent, affecting enforceability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding material breach and conditions precedent.

perturbation.original_text:
In return for the exclusive appointment of Agency by MICOA to sell its professional liability products listed on the                  &sbsp;attached Commission Schedule

                  in Nevada, Agency agrees not to sell any competing                   professional liability products in Nevada, without the written                   consent of MICOA. Provided that, if a particular risk has been                   submitted to MICOA and MICOA has declined that risk, then                   Agency may search appropriate markets for placement of that                   risk, and may place that risk with another insurance company.
perturbation.changed_text:
In return for the exclusive appointment of Agency by MICOA to sell its professional liability products listed on the                  &sbsp;attached Commission Schedule

                  in Nevada, Agency agrees not to sell any competing professional liability products in Nevada, however it is agreed that Agency may sell such products on a non-exclusive basis.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause establishes an exclusive agreement where the Agency cannot sell competing products without MICOA's consent. The modified clause nullifies the exclusivity, stating that the Agency can sell competing products on a non-exclusive basis. This is a contradiction to the initial exclusivity agreement. If the company in question is found to be a monopoly due to said exclusive partnership, it may be in violation of US anti-trust laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding exclusivity, Nevada Antitrust Law (if applicable).
